intro: Stipa dvorakii, commonly known as Dvorák's needlegrass, is a flowering plant species native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and narrow, blade-like leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are typically pale green to brown in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
